<h3 id="X1327">X(1327)&nbsp;=&nbsp;ARCTAN(3) KIEPERT POINT</h3>
Trilinears&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;f(A,B,C) : f(B,C,A) : f(C,A,B), 
where f(A,B,C) = 1/(sin A + 3 cos A)<br>
Barycentrics&nbsp;&nbsp; 1/(3 SA + S) : :
<p>
Let BB<sub>A</sub>C<sub>A</sub>C be the external square on side BC, and define CC<sub>B</sub>A<sub>B</sub>A and AA<sub>C</sub>B<sub>C</sub>B cyclically. The lines A<sub>B</sub>B<sub>A</sub>, B<sub>C</sub>C<sub>B</sub>, C<sub>A</sub>A<sub>C</sub> form a triangle perspective to triangle ABC, and the perspector is X(1327).</p>

<p>If you have The Geometer's Sketchpad, you can view <a href="X(1327).gsp" style="font-weight: bold">X(1327)</a>.
</p>
<p>X(1327) lies on these lines: {1,13667}, {2,6396}, {3,10195}, {4,6419}, {5,6426}, {6,1328}, {10,13688}, {11,13693}, {12,13694}, {13,25159}, {14,25169}, {17,2043}, {18,2044}, {20,3590}, {25,13668}, </p>
<p>
X(1327) lies on these circumconics: {A,B,C,X(2),X(4)}; {A,B,C,X(64),X(371)}; {A,B,C,X(74),X(588)}
</p>
<p>
X(1327) = {X(i),X(j)}-harmonic conjugate of X(k) for these (i,j,k): {1, 49195, 13717}, {1, 49196, 13716}, {2, 13678, 13701}, {2, 43256, 6396}, {3, 42602, 43254}, {4, 31414, 6419}, {6, 3845, 1328}, {6, 49260, 22541}, {6, 49261, 19099}, {372, 3545, 42603}, {381, 48677, 22806}, {485, 22644, 42260}, {485, 23251, 22644}, {1131, 23253, 371}, {1587, 35786, 42268}, {3070, 42269, 486}, {3830, 13665, 32787}, {3830, 32787, 6561}, {3830, 42284, 43503}, {3839, 35823, 42268}, {3845, 49362, 13691}, {5066, 13847, 42274}, {5066, 42216, 13847}, {6560, 6564, 42277}, {6561, 43503, 3830}, {6561, 43791, 13665}, {6564, 23249, 6560}, {13665, 42284, 6561}, {13667, 13679, 13702}, {13678, 13701, 13712}, {13704, 36353, 13712}, {13706, 36360, 13712}, {13713, 49114, 13666}, {13714, 13715, 1}, {13714, 49195, 13702}, {13715, 49196, 13702}, {13716, 13717, 13702}, {13932, 22616, 486}, {14241, 15682, 3068}, {15640, 43526, 43337}, {15686, 43211, 6409}, {19053, 41099, 6565}, {19099, 22541, 6}, {22872, 22917, 2}, {22872, 36396, 22917}, {22917, 36400, 22872}, {23267, 41099, 19053}, {31412, 35820, 5418}, {31412, 42414, 3316}, {31715, 31718, 35822}, {32787, 42284, 3830}, {32787, 42417, 6199}, {32788, 48677, 22616}, {33699, 52047, 42263}, {35786, 35823, 3839}, {36396, 36400, 2}, {41952, 52045, 8976}, {42272, 52045, 15681}, {42538, 43536, 6200}, {42602, 43254, 10195}, {49260, 49261, 6}, {49261, 49361, 1328}, {49262, 49364, 1328}
</p>
<p>
X(1327) =  midpoint of X(i) in X(j) for these {i,j}: {1, 13679}, {2, 33456}, {3, 13713}, {4, 13674}, {13690, 13691}, {49195, 49196}, {49361, 49362}
</p>
<p>
X(1327) = reflection of X(i) in X(j) for these {i,j}: {1, 13667}, {3, 49114}, {4, 13687}, {9541, 13720}, {13662, 13665}, {13666, 3}, {13678, 13701}, {13688, 10}, {13689, 402}, {13690, 49362}, {13691, 49361}, {13692, 5}, {13702, 1}, {13704, 33486}, {13706, 33487}, {13712, 2}, {13716, 13714}, {13717, 13715}, {13908, 50722}, {22616, 13932}, {22872, 33471}, {22917, 33470}, {48677, 22806}, {49361, 3845}
</p>
<p>
X(1327) = isogonal conjugate of X(6200)<br>
X(1327) = complement of X(13678)<br>
X(1327) = anticomplement of X(13701)<br>
X(1327) = X(i)-isoconjugate-of-X(j) for these {i, j}: {31, 32808}<br>
X(1327) = barycentric product X(i)*X(j) for these (i, j): {32809, 46204}<br>
X(1327) = barycentric quotient X(i)/X(j) for these (i, j): {2, 32808}, {6, 6200}, {32787, 13701}, {46204, 1328}<br>
</p>
